newsitem.title: GERMANY: Arthuis sees French 97 deficit within three pct.
newsitem.headline: Arthuis sees French 97 deficit within three pct.

text.p: French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said on Tuesday that France's 1997 total public deficit would be contained within the Maastrict Treaty limit of three percent of gross domestic product.
He declined to comment on whether the government, which presents the budget for 1997 on Wednesday, would announce that it planned to reduce the deficit to below three percent.
"The sum of public borrowing requirements will be contained within the limit of three percent," he told reporters after a meeting here of French and German finance ministers and central bankers.
